title: Dog fatally mauls 4-year-old boy in suburban Detroit
text:
A pit bull weighing 60lbs fatally mauled a four-year-old Michigan boy, despite his mother's desperate efforts to save him by stabbing the dog with a knife during the attack.

The boy, identified by family members as Benjamin Cobb, was pronounced dead on Tuesday night at a hospital after he suffered serious wounds to his neck and body in the attack in Hazel Park, north of Detroit.

Benjamin's 14-year-old sister called 911 at 6.45pm and reported that her mother was trying to stop the male pit bill from attacking her brother at their home in the 500 block of East Woodruff Avenue.

Scroll down for video

Benjamin Cobb, 4, was mauled to death on Tuesday by a pit bull his family had been fostering. The child suffered bites to the neck and all over his body

The deadly dog attack took place on East Woodruff Avenue in Hazel Park, Michigan

This is one of the Tasers police likely used on the 60-pound male pit bull to make the dog let go of the toddler on Tuesday evening

Police said Benjamin's 38-year-old mother cut the animal with a knife to defend her son, but the dog continued tearing at him, reported The Detroit News. She was hospitalized for dog bite injuries.

Officers used stun guns to free the boy from the dog, which was later taken to a veterinarian and euthanized.

The family released a statement on Wednesday, saying that they had taken in the pit bull 'as a kind gesture to help a friend in need,' and that until Tuesday, the animal had 'never shown aggressive behaviors.'

'This has taken an unimaginable toll on our family, friends, and all those who knew our sweet boy,' the statement reads.

A file image of pit bull, the breed of dog that mauled to death the 4-year-old in front of his mother and sister

Benjamin's 14-year-old sister (pictured with her back to the camera) witnessed the attack and called 911 to summon help

Benjamin;s 38-year-old mother (right) grabbed a knife and stabbed the dog

'A preliminary finding appears that this case was a tragic incident and the investigation continues to determine why the dog attacked the boy,' officials said Tuesday night. 'The Hazel Park Police Department extends its sympathy to the family and friends of the deceased.'

The family has launched a GoFundMe campaign to raise $10,000 for Benjamin's funeral expenses.

Photos posted on the boy's mother's Facebook page show the toddler baking Halloween-themed cupcakes with his grandmother and admiring houses decorated for the holiday.

The deadly dog attack comes less than three months after nine-year-old Emma Hernandez was mauled to death by a pit bull while riding a bike in her neighborhood in Detroit.
description: Benjamin Cobb, aged 4, was at his family's home in suburban Detroit with his mother and 14-year-old sister when the dog they had been fostering lunged at him, inflicting mortal wounds to his neck.
